urls.title: £39,000 invested in fisheries in Cambridgeshire and Bedfordshire
urls.description: The Environment Agency has invested over £1.3 million in projects in the last year to enhance fisheries, boost fish stocks and make improvements for anglers.

tweets.text:
We worked with St Neots angling society, @huntsdc & @stneotscouncil on a backwater enhancement project on the river Great Ouse🐟

The work involved removing silt, clearing vegetation, removing fallen tree branches and more. Before & after pics👇Read more: https://t.co/zXMQCbQUl9 https://t.co/doT0HeKqWJ

@DefraGovUK Try halting the decline of the human species in Newcastle under Lyme before we all die out from hydrogen sulphide and methane exposure + high particulate matter! #stopthestink @EnvAgency @PHE_WestMids

This is very worrying. I will ensure that @NewsNBC and  @StaffordshireCC do all they can to hold those responsible to account and help to bring an end to this terrible situation. #EnoughIsEnough #capitoff https://t.co/h9f2sRF58G
Shame on them, wringing their hands while children suffer #stopthestink https://t.co/Tlxe3pJjH3

@HelenVi00175623 @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe Using WHO guidelines for H2S is a smokescreen. It's impossible to measure with accuracy the effects of molecules of H2S on every adult and child for every minute of the day and night. The agencies need to act on the high volume of complaints and symptoms. That's the evidence.
